text: Elmer Williams (1905–1962) was an American jazz tenor saxophonist, known for his work with Chick Webb. He joined Webb in 1927, leaving in 1936 to join Fletcher Henderson. ==References== Category:1905 births Category:1962 deaths Category:American jazz tenor saxophonists Category:American male saxophonists Category:African-American jazz musicians Category:20th-century saxophonists Category:20th-century American male musicians Category:American male jazz musicians
title: Elmer Williams (saxophonist)
